page.title: 01General Survey of Whitley
page.content: Whitley is a rural Cheshire village just 9.5 kms south of Warrington and 8 kms from Northwich. It is just off the M56 and between the A49 and A559. The population is around 540 people. The main industry is agriculture with 20% of the working population involved.All mains services except Gas and Sewage. No shops,but mobile deliveries of milk fish,bread,post and papers.There is an Anglican Church, Methodist Chapel, a Friends' Meeting House and four public houses. The School and Village Hall play important roles in our parish and surroundings, e.g., through activities and events which bring the population together.}Behind the Village hall is the Scout hut and there is also a Guide hut. There are many pits and ponds left from earlier sand and clay extraction. Whitley is a Whitebelt area so new building is not allowed.
